comments:
Hi All,

This bug seems to have resurfaced with M5 again. I tried using the M4 version of EMF but that did not help much.

I had this issue while using VE.

Thanks
Allam

+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #167992 +++

Driver:  WTP 2.0 wtp-sdk-I-I200612140135-200612140135.zip driver using Eclipse driver eclipse-SDK-I20061213-1300-win32.zip.

When going through Web services bottom-up scenario, I got the error:

IWAB0019E Error in getting method from Java bean.
    java.lang.ClassCastException: java.lang.Boolean
    at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.util.EContentsEList$FeatureIteratorImpl.hasNext(EContentsEList.java:440)
    at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.util.EcoreUtil$ProperContentIterator.hasNext(EcoreUtil.java:1207)
    at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.util.EcoreUtil$ContentTreeIterator.hasNext(EcoreUtil.java:1388)
    at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.impl.ResourceImpl.attached(ResourceImpl.java:834)
    at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.impl.BasicEObjectImpl.eBasicSetContainer(BasicEObjectImpl.java:921)
    at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.impl.EStructuralFeatureImpl$InternalSettingDelegateSingleContainer.dynamicInverseAdd(EStructuralFeatureImpl.java:1888)
    at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.impl.BasicEObjectImpl.eDynamicInverseAdd(BasicEObjectImpl.java:1019)
    at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.impl.BasicEObjectImpl.eDynamicInverseAdd(BasicEObjectImpl.java:1013)
    at org.eclipse.jem.java.internal.impl.JavaClassImpl.eInverseAdd(JavaClassImpl.java:1773)
    at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.util.EcoreEList.inverseAdd(EcoreEList.java:282)
    at org.eclipse.emf.common.notify.impl.NotifyingListImpl.addUnique(NotifyingListImpl.java:318)
    at org.eclipse.emf.common.util.BasicEList.add(BasicEList.java:626)
    at org.eclipse.jem.internal.java.adapters.JavaReflectionKey.getJavaClass(JavaReflectionKey.java:176)
    at org.eclipse.jem.internal.java.adapters.JavaReflectionKey.getJavaType(JavaReflectionKey.java:332)
    at org.eclipse.jem.internal.java.adapters.JavaReflectionKey.getJavaObject(JavaReflectionKey.java:277)
    at org.eclipse.jem.internal.java.adapters.JavaReflectionKey.get(JavaReflectionKey.java:134)
    at org.eclipse.jem.internal.java.adapters.JavaXMIFactoryImpl$JavaXMIResource.getEObject(JavaXMIFactoryImpl.java:102)
    at org.eclipse.jem.internal.util.emf.workbench.ProjectResourceSetImpl.getEObject(ProjectResourceSetImpl.java:188)
    at org.eclipse.jem.java.internal.impl.JavaRefFactoryImpl.reflectType(JavaRefFactoryImpl.java:401)
    at org.eclipse.jem.java.internal.impl.JavaRefFactoryImpl.reflectType(JavaRefFactoryImpl.java:388)
    at org.eclipse.jst.ws.internal.common.JavaMOFUtils.getJavaClass(JavaMOFUtils.java:199)
    at org.eclipse.jst.ws.internal.axis.creation.ui.command.JavaToWSDLMethodCommand.execute(JavaToWSDLMethodCommand.java:83)

I ran into similar ClassClassException with top-down or client scenario.

The WSE ran OK though.

I tried the patch for but 167751 but the same problem occurs.  I even tried moving org.eclipse.core.runtime to the bottom of required bundle but the same problem occurs.  This problem was not in the WTP 2.0 wtp-sdk-I-I200612121445-200612121445.zip driver using eclipse-SDK-I20061211-1607-win32.zip.

We had been able to successfully create bottom-up, top-down Web services and create Web services clients with recent WTP 2.0 driver (e.g. http://download.eclipse.org/webtools/committers/drops/R2.0/S-2.0M6-200704050411/).  Could you please provide the Java bean that you were using and detail steps on reproducing the problem?

Created an attachment (id=63254)
error log from eclipse

error log from eclipse when we try to use visual editor

Thanks for the response:
pls refer to the attached error log (in the earlier comment) from eclipse for more details. This occurs when we try to use Visual Editor in M5.

I have checked with web service creation, it seemed to work fine in the same environment.

I'm also not changing the status to reopen bug, leaving it to you to decide (as I'm not anymore currently working on this)


the update from the mail is given below

==
Thanks for checking up on this. The trace in the message bug description is because of the cloning of the Bug #167992.
I had faced this issue while using the "visual editor" which is not related to WS. I will reply to bug post with exact exception trace information asap (2-3 days), pls bear with me on this, am working on diff phase of this project now.

Anyways I'm using Webservice wizard for a diff assignment, and its good news as I had gone back to WTP1.5
==
As you had verified that Web service creation is OK with M5, please close this defect and open another one on the VE product to track the problem with VE.  Thanks!
Closing based on comments from Kathy.
